entries.title: Senior Front-End Developer
entries.extra: At Rokoko I created the RokokoCare portal, a web application for physiotherapists to manage their patients and corresponding exercise programs that are then tracked and evaluated using skeleton tracking via a mobile app. At Rokoko I also worked on several proof-of-concept projects to evaluate Blazor for WebAssembly as a way to bring our C# motion capture codebase to the Web and render mocap scenes using ThreeJS

entries.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
entries.extra: At LearnWorlds I was a member of the Authoring Tools team, working on new features & widgets for the LearnWorlds webpage builder. Features I worked on include payment widgets, animated progress widgets and a JSON schema based form builder.

entries.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
entries.extra: Freelanced for a few projects of Good Fellas, including the redesigned CallistaCrafts.com website, where I created from scratch the custom interface. At Good Fellas, I really enjoyed experimenting with WebGL-based visual effects synced to the DOM, using ThreeJS.

entries.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
entries.extra: I led the transition from Grunt to Webpack, introduced StorybookJS and created from scratch the Giaola UI Components kit, using VueJS, SCSS and the principles of atomic design. At Giaola, I single-handedly implemented the front-end of new verticals with advanced UI requirements, while keeping the components library DRY and on par with the designs.

entries.title: Founder & Technical Director
entries.extra: BlockLicense was a startup incubated at Eurobank's EGG program aiming to revolutionalize the way digital works are licensed by embedding the creator's license into media assets without affecting their functionality. An MVP was created that allowed creators to embed complex licensing and revenue sharing flows, while allowing buyers to instantaneously buy a license for the desired work. At BlockLicense, I single-handedly created the MVP using VueJS, Electron, Adobe XMP and smart Ethereum Blockchain contracts.

entries.title: Creative Coder & Maker
entries.organization: The Office for Experimental Media, Athens, GR
entries.extra: Self Employed - I  collaborated with a few interactive media artists, creating custom electronics and software that brought their works to life. By sensing the environment and controlling audio visual equipment, rich experiences were created such as video projections with interactive real-time graphics.

entries.title: IT Support
entries.extra: At JNL+ I was a jack of all trades. My responsibilities included being the admin of the Windows Server based company-wide network and an on-premises render farm. I also created mini websites for customers and worked on internal interactive prototypes.

entries.title: Artist in Residence
entries.organization: Salzburger Plattform für Medienkunst & Experimentelle Technologien, Salzburg, AT
entries.extra: A two month artist residency in Salzburg, where I designed a CNC machine that can print Buddhist sand mandalas.

entries.title: Researcher, Multimedia Technology
entries.extra: Member of CADET, a project funded by the Austrian government, working on the implementation of a new dataflow programming environment based in C++ and OpenGL for creative applications.

entries.title: Adjunct Lecturer, Physical Computing
entries.extra: Taught an introductory course on physical computing to postgraduate students of the fachhochschule. The class was structured around hands-on workshops, where students were encouraged to try things out. The class scored top points among the classes in the curriculum in the evaluation by the students.

entries.title: Creative Coding Freelancer
entries.extra: Lead software developer in Eddie Opara’s team, at the legendary - among graphic designers - Pentagram NYC office. At Pentagram, I created real-time interactive graphics for the large-scale touch-table designed and installed at the SCAD Museum of Art in Savannah, USA. I also worked on smaller projects where I created tools and scripts for Adobe Illustrator to assist designers in the creation of their desired content.

entries.title: Creative Coding Intern
entries.extra: At Potion I worked on procedural real-time graphics for the the award-winning interactive tables and wall installed at the NOVIY Bar Restaurant in Moscow, Russia.

entries.title: Creative Technologist Freelancer
entries.extra: Among several projects created the “Marlboro Sensor Glove” for Arc Worldwide, an interactive installation that toured several cities in Greece as part of the promotion for Marlboro cigarettes.
